content: Brazil's Supreme Court has been expanding its powers in recent years, allowing it to act as an investigator, prosecutor and judge all at once in some cases. This has led to some judges jailing people without trial for posts on social media that they believe attack Brazil's institutions, ordering social networks to remove thousands of posts and videos with little room for appeal and sentencing a congressman to nearly nine years in prison. Legal experts say that this power grab by the Supreme Court has undermined a key democratic institution in Latin America's biggest country, as voters prepare to pick a president on Oct. 2.
